dialogues.KIRK:
[1]Make it two -- her shot's on me. 
[2]Don't you want my name before you completely reject me? 
[3]You are good without it. It's Jim. Jim Kirk. If you don't tell me your name, I'm gonna have to make one up. 
[4]Uhura? No way -- that's the name I was gonna make up for you. Uhura what? 
[5]They don't have last names in your world? 
[6]They don't have first names in your world? Wait, let me guess. Is it "Jim"? 
[7]Okay, so you're a cadet. Studying. What's your focus? 
[8]Let me guess: study of Alien languages: phonology, morphology, syntax-- it means you've got a talented tongue. 
[9]Well.    Not only. 
[10]Oh, baby, I'm the smartest. 
[11]You could handle me.    That's an invitation. 
[12]At ease, Cup Cake, it was a joke.     Like your hairline. 
[13]You heard me, Moon Beam. 
[14]Okay, so go get some more guys, come back and it'll be an even fight. 
[15]You can... whistle really loud, y'know that? 
[16]... and who am I, Captain Pike? 
[17]He sure learned his lesson. 
[18]-- why are you talking to me? 
[19]Maybe I love it. 
[20]Come to think of it, I do want to feel special. You know what? I'm gonna go start a book club-- 
[21]Enlist. You must be way down on your recruiting quota for the month-- 
[22]We're even, right?   I can go. 
[23]Live it up. 
[24]Four years?   I'm gonna do it in three. 
[25]At ease, Gentlemen. Never did get that first name. 
[26]I think these things're pretty safe-- 
[27]I hate to break this to you, but Starfleet operates in space. 
[28]Jim Kirk-- you really gonna throw up--? 
[29]So you'll do it for me, right? 
[30]I didn't ask if you have interest, I asked if you'd do it. 
[31]Because I've failed the test twice. 
[32]So Bones: why do they make us take it? 
[33]And you're the greatest -- thank you. 
[34]Oh, no-- Bones -- I gotta date. 
[35]You have no idea how prepared I'm gonna be-- no idea. 
[36]... Yeah. I sent you a message. 
[37]Your hearing is scary-- you sure both your parents are human? 
[38]You and I have a big day tomorrow -- 
[39]If I pass, will you tell me your first name? 
[40]I think the fact that you picked up a transmission of a Klingon prison escape is very interesting. 
[41]"Starfleet Command has ordered us to rescue them... Captain." 
[42]That's okay. 
[43]Yeah, don't worry about it. 
[44]Nah. 
[45]Alert medical bay to prepare to receive all crew members from the damaged ship. 
[46]Alert medical. 
[47]I understand. 
[48]Mmmm... no. 
[49]Arm photons. Prepare to fire on the Klingon warbirds. 
[50]Are they? 
[51]Fire on all enemy ships -- one photon each should do -- let's not waste ammunition. 
[52]Begin rescue of the stranded crew. So. We've eliminated all enemy ships, no one on board was injured and the successful rescue of the Kobayashi Maru crew is underway. 
[53]Anything else? 
[54]Yessir. I believe I have the right to face my accuser directly. 
[55]Your point being? 
[56]Respectfully.    Define "cheating". 
[57]Now let me ask you something I think we all know the answer to: the test is rigged, isn't it? You programmed it to be unwinnable. 
[58]Because if I'm right, Sir, then the test itself is a cheat. 
[59]I don't believe in no-win scenarios -- 
[60]Please, enlighten me. 
[61]"I of all people?" 
[62]How long did it take you to look that up? 
[63]Maybe you just don't like that I beat your test. 
[64]What an idiot I am for taking that personally -- 
[65]Enlighten me again. 
[66]So you're telling me the point.      Of the whole thing. Is to be afraid? 
[67]Have you taken the test, Commander Spork? 
[68]You keep reminding me that you're Vulcan. And I'm sure you're really proud of that, who wouldn't be-- but isn't it true you people don't experience fear at all? 
[69]And if that's the case -- What's that say about your ability to make command decisions? 
[70]Who was that pointy-eared bastard? 
[71]Excuse me, you didn't call my name. Kirk, James T.. 
[72]... yeah-- yeah, you go... I'm good. 
[73]What are you doing? 
[74]I might throw up on you. 
[75]Bones. Thanks for getting me on board. But I don't feel right. I feel like I'm leaking. 
[76]-- what's this?! 
[77]-- Bones -- we have to stop the ship-- 
[78]--- what? How the hell would I know?     Is Uhura on board? 
[79]Computer, locate crew member Uhura -- 
[80]We're flying into a trap. 
[81]-- ow!   Stop it! 
[82]The transmission from the Klingon prison planet -- what exactly did you hear? 
[83]Who was it who escaped? What was the ship that was stolen--?! -- what's happening to my mouth? 
[84]Numb tongue? 
[85]
[86]Captain Pike-- Sir, we have to stop ship! 
[87]Vulcan isn't experiencing a natural disaster, it's being attacked -- by Romulans. 
[88]Fact: the same anomaly -- a lighting storm in space -- that we saw today also occurred on the day of my birth, before a Romulan ship attacked the U.S.S. Kelvin. You know that, I read your dissertation. Which was good. 
[89]Fact: This ship -- which had formidable and advanced weaponry -- was never seen or heard from again -- fact: the Kelvin attack took place on the edge of Klingon space and at 11-hundred hours last night there was an escape from a Klingon prison planet -- Rura Penthe -- fact: the escaped prisoners were Romulans, Sir, and it was reported that they stole a ship from the prison dock. 
[90]We're warping into a trap-- there are Romulans waiting for us, I promise you that. 
[91]It's because they're being attacked. Captain. Please. 
[92]... okay. 
[93]Once we knock out that machine... Sir, what happens to you? 
[94]So what kinda combat training d'you have? 
[95]... fencing. 
[96]
[97]
[98]Kirk to Enterprise -- they just launched something toward the planet! 
[99]
[100]
[101]
[102]
[103]... yeah, not a problem. 
[104]The surface of what? YOU'RE GOING DOWN THERE? Are you nuts?! 
[105]Hey. Listen, about what happened at Starfleet. The test and everything-- I know it looks like I was... using you, or whatever. And I'm sorry. I really am. And... I just hope you'll forgive me. 
[106]... you're not Gaila, are you? 
[107]Sorry. 
[108]Earth may be his next stop, but we have to assume every Federation planet's a target. 
[109]That is what he's suggesting and I don't buy it. 
[110]Then what would an angry future Romulan want with Captain Pike? 
[111]What we need to do is catch up to that ship. Disable it, take it over and get Pike back. 
[112]"Illogical"-- you're funny. 
[113]-- what about assigning Engineering crews to try and boost our warp yield? 
[114]There won't be a next engagement, Spock: by the time we've "gathered", it'll be too late -- how many planets are you willing to risk? You say he's from the future? Knows what's gonna happen? Then the logical thing is to be unpredictable. 
[115]Yeah, don't worry ab -- 
[116]Computer...    where am I? 
[117]Bite me, how's that. 
[118]
[119]Lieutenant's log, supplemental: I'm preparing a testimonial for my Starfleet court martial assuming there's still a Starfleet left. 
[120]Acting Captain Spock -- whose only form of expression's apparently limited to his left damn eyebrow -- has marooned me on Delta Vega in what I believe to be a violation of security protocol 49.09, governing the treatment of prisoners aboard a st-- 
[121]Hey... thank you... 
[122]-- how d'you know my name? 
[123]
[124]-- no, I don't know you -- the only Vulcan I know isn't exactly a buddy. 
[125]Stop.   Please.     I don't understand. 
[126]Bullshit. 
[127]Old friend. Sir, I don't have any idea how you know what you know. But I don't know you and if you are Spock we're not friends. You hate me. You marooned me here for mutiny... 
[128]You're the captain.   Pike was taken hostage. 
[129]What do you know about him? 
[130]What're you doing--? 
[131]Nero's planet was destroyed-- 
[132]... so you do feel... 
[133]Going back in time... you changed all our lives. 
[134]Tactical and Communications -- 
[135]-- he's the helmsman, why? 
[136]... he'd call it a damn miracle. 
[137]Where you came from... did I know my father? 
[138]... Captain? 
[139]
[140]... hello?! 
[141]Excuse me? 
[142]What? 
[143]You know him? 
[144]I know that dog. What happened to it? 
[145]What is he talking about? 
[146]-- you're coming with us, right? 
[147]You're telling me I can't tell you I'm following your own orders? Why not? What happens? 
[148]How, over your dead body? 
[149]So I need to emotionally compromise you? 
[150]Hm. 
[151]You know... coming back in time... changing history... that's cheating. 
[152]-- no-- shit! 
[153]-- no--nonono-- 
[154]COMEONCOMEONCOMEON -- like the simulator: manual control enabled, pressure seal: enabled -- shutdown-- 
[155]
[156]You all right? 
[157]-- let's get to the bridge-- 
[158]Surprise. 
[159]He's with me. 
[160]You're the genius, you figure it out. 
[161]Well I'm not telling. Captain. 
[162]Does that frustrate you? My lack of cooperation... does it make you angry? 
[163]-- Don't answer him. 
[164]What is it about you, Spock? Your planet was just destroyed -- your mother murdered -- and you're not even upset? 
[165]HA! And yet you said fear was necessary for command. I mean -- did you see that bastard's ship? Did you see what he did? 
[166]So are you afraid or aren't you?!? 
[167]Then why don't you stop me. 
[168]What is it like? Not to feel? Anger. Or heartbreak. Or the need to stop at nothing to avenge the death of the woman who gave birth to you?! 
[169]You must not feel anything! It must not even compute for you! You must not have loved her at all--! 
[170]Yeah we do. 
[171]Thanks for the support! 
[172]... so do I. Attention crew of the Enterprise.   This is James Kirk... 
[173]Mr. Spock has resigned commission and advanced me to acting Captain. I know you were all expecting to regroup with the fleet, but I've ordered a pursuit course of the enemy ship to Earth. 
[174]I want all departments at battle stations and ready in ten minutes. Either we're going down, or they are. Kirk out. 
[175]-- yeah, you know that's complicated -- 
[176]No. No, I won't-- hey, I'm the Captain now! I don't have to tell you anything! Now listen: we need to figure out a way to catch up and get to Nero's ship. 
[177]Then we find a way to get on that ship and steal the black hole device away from them. 
[178]Uhura: anything from Captain Pike? 
[179]Yes, Chekov-- you don't need to ask permission to-- 
[180]What blind spot? 
[181]I won't order you to do that, Mr. Spock. 
[182]Then I'm coming with you. 
[183]See, we're getting to know each other. 
[184]Whatever happens Mr. Sulu, if you feel you have a tactical advantage fire on that ship. Even if we're still aboard. It's an order. 
[185]Her first name is... 
[186]Energize. 
[187]Mine had a gun. 
[188]Is he alive? 
[189]Let's move. 
[190]Spock, you'll be piloting the ship alone. 
[191]Wow.   That's weird. 
[192]Just trust me.      Can ya do that? 
[193]I'll get Pike. 
[194]Came back, Sir. Just like you ordered. 
[195]Nice timing, Lieutenant -- 
[196]Hail them -- now! 
[197]This is Captain James T. Kirk of the U.S.S. Enterprise -- your ship is compromised -- too close to the singularity to survive without assistance -- which we are willing to provide. 
[198]We show them compassion-- it may be the only way to earn peace with Romulus. It's logic, Spock! I thought you'd like that. 
[199]You got it. Lock phasers! Fire everything we've got! 
[200]Kirk to Engineering: get us out of here, Scotty! 
[201]
[202]
[203]
[204]
[205]I relieve you, Sir. 
[206]Thank you, Sir. 
[207]Scotty how are we? 
[208]Mr. Sulu, prepare to engage thrus-- 
[209]... Permission granted. 
[210]It would be my honor, Commander. Maneuvering thrusters, Mr. Sulu.     Take us out. 
[211]I relieve you, Sir. 
[212]Thank you, Sir. 
[213]Admit it, Spock. For people like us, the journey itself... is home.
dialogues.SPOCK:
[1]No. 
[2]I am hardly "anxious", mother. And "fine" has variable definitions. "Fine" is unacceptable. 
[3]May I ask a personal query? 
[4]Should I choose to complete the Vulcan discipline of Kolinahr... and purge all emotion... I trust you will not feel it reflects judgement upon you. 
[5]It was logical to cultivate multiple options. 
[6]If you would clarify, Minister-- what "disadvantage" are you referring to? 
[7]Council -- ministers.    I must decline. 
[8]Then as I am half-human, your record remains untarnished. 
[9]I came with the intention of enrolling, as my father wished. However, your "insight" has convinced me otherwise. Therefore, the only emotion I wish to convey is gratitude. Thank you, Ministers, for your consideration. Live long and prosper. 
[10]... I do not know. 
[11]Cadet Kirk. It is obvious you somehow managed to install and activate a sub- routine in the programming code, thereby changing the conditions of the test. 
[12]To deceive by trickery. 
[13]Your argument precludes the possibility of a no-win scenario -- 
[14]Then not only have you violated the rules, you've failed to understand the principle lesson. 
[15]You, of all people should know, Cadet Kirk -- A captain cannot cheat death. 
[16]Your father, Lieutenant George Kirk, had assumed command of his vessel before killed in action, did he not? 
[17]How long did it take you to program the virus that allowed you to cheat? 
[18]I am Vulcan. "Like" is not a verb in our vernacular. I've simply made the logical deduction that you're a liar. 
[19]Agreed. Furthermore, you have failed to divine the purpose of the test. 
[20]The purpose is to experience fear. Fear in the face of certain death. To accept that fear and maintain command of one's self and one's crew. This is a quality expected in every Starfleet captain. 
[21]Fear is necessary, yes. 
[22]Spock. As a Vulcan, I require no additional training to control my narcissism when making command decisions. 
[23]Yes, Lieutenant? 
[24]Indeed you were -- 
[25]An exceptional achievement, to be su-- 
[26]Consistently, yes-- 
[27]It was an attempt to avoid the appearance of favoritism. 
[28]Oh.     Yes, I believe you are. 
[29]Captain, engineering reports "ready for launch". 
[30]Have you disengaged the External Inertial Dampener? 
[31]The cadet's logic is sound. And Lieutenant Uhura is unmatched in xenolinguistics, we would be wise to accept her conclusion. 
[32]Captain, they're locking torpedoes! 
[33]Captain, the Romulan ship has lowered some kind of high energy pulse device into the Vulcan atmosphere-- its signal appears to be blocking our communications and transporter abilities! 
[34]Pardon me. But I don't believe you and I are acquainted. 
[35]Captain. Please. I apologize, but the complexities of human pranks escape me. 
[36]Dr. Puri, report -- 
[37]Then you have just inherited his responsibility as Chief Medical Officer. 
[38]Chekov, run gravitational sensors -- I want to know what they're doing to the planet. 
[39]They're creating a black hole... at the center of Vulcan? 
[40]How long does the planet have? 
[41]Alert Vulcan Command Center to signal a planetwide evacuation-- all channels, all frequencies -- maintain standard orbit -- 
[42]To evacuate the Vulcan High Council-- they're tasked with protecting our cultural history. My parents will be among them-- 
[43]It's not possible -- they'll be in the Katrik Arc, I must get them myself-- 
[44]Step aside -- I'm going to the surface. 
[45]Energize -- 
[46]The planet's not safe, it has only seconds left -- we must evacuate now -- 
[47]Spock to Enterprise: take us back now! 
[48]
[49]Acting Captain's log. Stardate 2256.42: I have assumed command of the Enterprise. 
[50]We've heard no word from Captain Pike. I have therefore classified him a hostage of the war criminal known as Nero. 
[51]Nero, who has destroyed my home planet. And most of its six billion inhabitants. I estimate no more than ten thousand survived. While the essence of our culture has been saved, in the elders who now reside upon this ship... I am now a member of an endangered species. 
[52]... I need... 
[53]I need for us all to continue performing admirably. 
[54]Lieutenant, have you confirmed that Nero is headed for Earth? 
[55]That's not it.     He said he wanted me to see something.     The destruction of my home planet. 
[56]The engineering comprehension necessary to artificially create a black hole may suggest the answer: such technology could theoretically be manipulated to create a tunnel through space time. 
[57]If you eliminate the impossible, whatever remains -- however improbable -- must be the truth. 
[58]Captain Pike left us with standing orders to rendezvous with the fleet on the other side of the quadrant. 
[59]We're technologically outmatched in every way. A rescue attempt would be illogical. 
[60]We must gather with the rest of Starfleet to balance the terms of our next engagement -- 
[61]You're assuming Nero knows how events are predicted to unfold. The contrary: Nero's very presence has altered the flow of history, beginning with the attack on the U.S.S. Kelvin, culminating in the events of today -- thereby creating a new chain of incidents that cannot be anticipated by either party. 
[62]Precisely. Whatever lives we might have lived, if the time continuum was disrupted... our destinies have changed. Mr. Sulu, plot a course for the Laurentian system, Warp Factor Three-- 
[63]Yes, Doctor. I'm aware that James Kirk is a friend of yours. Supporting me, as you did, must have been difficult. 
[64]I'm simply acknowledging your difficulties. 
[65]I welcome it. 
[66]... a curious metaphor, Doctor. As a stallion must first be broken before it can reach its potential. 
[67]I intended to assist in the effort to re- establish communication with Starfleet. However, if crew morale would be better served by my roaming the halls weeping, I'll gladly defer to your medical expertise. 
[68]I calculate no more than a four meter margin of error. 
[69]Bring up video. 
[70]Security, this is the captain -- seal engineering deck and bring me the intruders in turbine station three -- set phasers to stun. 
[71]Who are you? 
[72]We're travelling at warp -- how did you manage to get aboard this ship? 
[73]As Captain of this vessel I order you to answer the question. 
[74]You are not a member of this ship's crew. Under penalty of court martial, I order you to explain to me how you beamed ab -- 
[75]You will answer me. 
[76]Escort them to the Brig. 
[77]Your presumption that these experiences interfere with my abilities to command this ship is inaccurate-- 
[78]Yes, of course I-- 
[79]I will not... allow you to lecture me about the merits of emotion. 
[80]Step away from me, Mr. Kirk. 
[81]-- back away -- 
[82]Doctor. I am no longer fit for duty. I hereby relinquish my command on the grounds that I have been... emotionally compromised. Please note the time and date in the ship's log. 
[83]That would be unwise. 
[84]I feel as conflicted as I once was. As a child. Have I made so little progress? 
[85]I feel anger. For the one who took her life. An anger I cannot stop. 
[86]Doctor... Mr. Chekov is correct. 
[87]I have reviewed his telemetry. If Mr. Sulu can maneuver us into position, I can beam aboard Nero's ship. 
[88]Romulans and Vulcans share a common ancestry. Our cultural similarities will make it easier for me to access their ship's computer to locate the device. 
[89]Also, my mother was human. Which makes Earth the only home I have left. 
[90]I would cite regulation, but I know you will simply ignore it. 
[91]Thank you, Nyota. 
[92]I have no comment on the matter. 
[93]I am trained in the Vulcan martial art of Suus Mahna. 
[94]I am unable to meld with these Romulans -- there are subtle differences in their physiology I did not anticipate -- 
[95]What you refer to as the "Red Matter Device" is in the main hangar -- and I've located Captain Pike. 
[96]Unknown. 
[97]Which may be problematic, as I am unfamiliar with this ship's design. 
[98]Computer: what is your manufacturing origin? 
[99]It appears you've been keeping rather important information from me. 
[100]Under authority granted me by the Europa convention, I'm confiscating this illegally obtained ship and order you to surrender your vessel. No terms. No deals. 
[101]Last warning: unconditional surrender or you will be destroyed. 
[102]Computer, prepare self destruct sequence. 
[103]Captain -- what are you doing? 
[104]No, not really, not this time. 
[105]Father...? 
[106]... Fascinating. 
[107]Then why did you send Kirk aboard when you alone could've explained the truth? 
[108]... it was a test? 
[109]How did you persuade him to keep your secret? 
[110]You lied. 
[111]A gamble... 
[112]The future's not what it used to be... in the face of extinction, it's only logical I resign my Starfleet commission and help rebuild our race. 
[113]My future cannot be determined by your past. We are one, but not the same. 
[114]Permission to come aboard, Captain. 
[115]As you have yet to select a first officer, respectfully, I would like to submit my candidacy. Should you desire, I can provide character references.
dialogues.SPOCK PRIME:
[1]... Jim? 
[2]How did you find me--? Does Starfleet know of my presence? 
[3]I have been... and always shall be... your friend. 
[4]You are James T. Kirk. Your father is George, as is your brother. Your mother's name is Winona -- you were born in 2233 -- 
[5]... I am Spock. One hundred and thirty years senior to the Vulcan you know. 
[6]It's remarkably pleasing to see you again. ... especially after the events of today. 
[7]Mutiny?   You are not the Captain? 
[8]... by Nero. 
[9]... he is a remarkably... 
[10]troubled Romulan. ... Please. Allow me -- it will be easier-- 
[11]Our minds... one and together...One hundred and twenty-seven years from now everything ends. 
[12]A star in Beta Quadrant will go supernova -- and like a cancer left untreated... it will grow... and destroy everything. 
[13]I saw the beginning of it myself. Vulcan Science Academy devised a plan to stop it. 
[14]We built a ship containing a material capable of generating the only thing powerful enough to consume a supernova. A black hole. 
[15]I agreed to pilot the ship. Knowing I would not return. 
[16]My sacrifice, in service of all races, seemed only logical. 
[17]Yes. He of course blamed us. Believed Vulcan allowed his planet to die. Which was hardly the case. Let me continue. 
[18]Nero came after me. Determined to thwart my mission. If Romulus was allowed to die, he said... all planets should share its fate. 
[19]I needed an exit. I knew if this mission failed... everyone, everywhere... would lose everything. 
[20]I realized: a large black hole could destroy the supernova. A smaller one... could be my escape. Could send me back in time, allowing me to complete my mission. So I created a black hole... 
[21]Nero must have understood what I was trying to do. Because he began racing for it. 
[22]Nero simply got to it first. How long I was travelling... I couldn't tell you. It was timeless. But when I arrived... 
[23]Nero was waiting for me. 
[24]Forgive me... emotional transference is an effect of the mind meld. 
[25]"Cthia" is the stricture that binds our emotions... but few of us are that perfectly Vulcan. 
[26]Yet remarkably, events within our timelines, characteristics, people... seem to overlap significantly. Tell me about the rest of the crew? Chekov-- Uhura --? 
[27]-- Sulu -- 
[28]Dr. McCoy would assert our meeting here is not a matter of coincidence... but rather, indication of a higher purpose. 
[29]Yes he would. Perhaps the time stream's way of attempting to mend itself. In both our histories, the same crew found its way onto the same ship in a time of ultimate crisis -- therein lies our advantage. We must go-- there's a Starfleet outpost not far from here. 
[30]... yes. You often spoke of him as your inspiration for joining starfleet. 
[31]You should know. He proudly lived to see you become captain of the Enterprise. 
[32]A ship we must return you to as soon as possible. 
[33]Are you the station chief? 
[34]... Fascinating. 
[35]You're Montgomery Scott. 
[36]You are in fact the Mr. Scott who postulated the theory of trans-warp beaming. 
[37]What if I told you your trans-warp theory was correct? That it is indeed possible to beam onto a ship that is travelling at warp speed. And that you only required the correct field equation to recrystallize dilithium? 
[38]The reason you haven't heard of it, Mr. Scott... is because you haven't discovered it yet. 
[39]Allow us access to your shuttle... and I will show you what a genius you actually are. 
[40]Your equation for achieving trans-warp beaming. 
[41]Point of fact: it did occur to you. Extrapolating Enterprise's course -- 
[42]Now's your chance, Mr. Scott. 
[43]Agreed: the aft engineering bay is your best option: a large space and no unpredictable airlocks -- 
[44]No, Jim. My destiny lies along a different path. 
[45]Trust me. Above all. Jim, this is the one rule you cannot break. To stop Nero, you alone must take command of your ship. 
[46]Preferably not. There is, however, Starfleet Regulation 619. Yes. I forget what little regard you had for such things. 619 states that any commanding officer who is emotionally compromised by the mission at hand... must resign said command. 
[47]Jim.  I just lost my planet. I can tell you.  I am emotionally compromised. What you must do... is get me to show it. 
[48]A trick I learned from an old friend. 
[49]Live long, and prosper. 
[50]I am not... our father. 
[51]There are so few Vulcans left.    We cannot afford to ignore each other. 
[52]Because you needed each other. Opposing yet complimentary opposites. It was that balance between us -- I should say you and Kirk -- that often made the impossible, possible. 
[53]I'm in no position to pass judgment... my actions have robbed you of much. I could not also deprive you the revelation of all you can accomplish together... of a friendship that will define you both in ways you cannot yet realize. 
[54]I inferred universe-ending paradoxes would ensue should he break his promise. 
[55]I implied. 
[56]An act of faith. One I hope you'll repeat in the future. 
[57]And yet, you are in a unique position... you can be in two places at once. 
[58]I urge you to remain in Starfleet: I've already located a suitable planet on which to establish a Vulcan colony, and assist in the foundation of a new science academy. 
[59]Then I ask that you do yourself a favor. Put away logic. Do what feels right. The world you've inherited lives in the shadow of incalculable devastation... but there's no reason you must face it alone. 
[60]As my customary farewell would appear oddly self serving, I will simply say... good luck. 
[61]Then I ask that you do yourself a favor... put away logic, and do what feels right. The world you've inherited lives in the shadow of incalculable devastation... but there's no reason you must face it alone. 
[62]This was a gift to me.   Representing... a dream. One we were unable to fulfill. The way you can now. 
[63]As my customary farewell would appear oddly self serving, I will simply say... good luck.
dialogues.PIKE:
[1]Outside, all of you!       NOW! 
[2]Y'alright, Son? 
[3]I couldn't believe when the bartender told me who you are. 
[4]Your father's son. For my dissertation, I was assigned the U.S.S. Kelvin. Something I admired about your dad... he didn't believe in no-win scenarios. 
[5]Depends on how you define winning. You're here, aren't you? That instinct to leap without looking-- that was his nature, too. And in my opinion it's something Starfleet has lost. We're admirable, respectable. But overly-disciplined. Those cadets you took on, they'll make competent officers -- but you can bet your ass they'll run home to momma the minute they're looking down the barrel of a Klingon phaser cannon. 
[6]I looked up your file while you were drooling on the floor. Your aptitude tests were off the charts-- what is it, d'you like being the only Genius Level repeat-offender in the midwest? 
[7]So your daddy dies... you can settle for a less-than-ordinary life. Or do you feel like you're meant for something better? Something special? 
[8]Enlist in Starfleet. 
[9]If you're half the man your father was, Jim, Starfleet could use you. You could be an officer in four years, have your own ship in eight. 
[10]Riverside shipyard. Shuttle for new recruits leaves tomorrow, 0800. Your father was Captain of a Starship. For twelve minutes. I dare you to do better. 
[11]... No.   Guess not. 
[12]Hold her a second... 
[13]Cheating isn't winning. 
[14]The maiden voyage of our newest flagship deserves more pomp and circumstance than we can afford today, but her christening will have to be our reward for a safe return-- All decks, this is Captain Pike. Prepare for immediate departure. Helm, thrusters. 
[15]Set course for Vulcan. 
[16]Maximum warp.    Punch it. 
[17]Lieutenant, where's Helmsman McKenna? 
[18]-- and you are a pilot, right? 
[19]Is the parking brake on? 
[20]The external inertial dampener. That's... the parking brake. 
[21]Let's punch it! 
[22]Russian whiz kid-- what's your name again? Chanko? Cherpov? 
[23]Fine, Chekov, Pavel H.: begin shipwide mission broadcast. 
[24]Cadet Kirk, I think you've had enough attention for one day -- Dr. McCoy, return to medical, we'll have words later. 
[25]And you know of this prison escape how? 
[26]Scan Vulcan space, check if any transmissions are being made in Romulan. 
[27]How about you -- you speak Romulan, Cadet...? 
[28]Uhura, relieve the Lieutenant -- Mr. Hannity, hail the U.S.S. Truman. 
[29]Shields up. Ready all weapons. 
[30]Full reverse, come about Starboard ninety degrees! Drop us down underneath them! Prepare to fire all weapons! 
[31]Get me Starfleet Command! 
[32]All power to forward shields -- prepare to fire all weapons! 
[33]Divert auxiliary power from port nacelle to the shields--! 
[34]I am Captain Christopher Pike, to whom am I speaking? 
[35]You've declared war against the Federation. Withdraw, and I'll agree to arrange a conference with Romulan leadership at a neutral loca-- 
[36]I understand that -- I need officers who have been trained in advanced hand-to-hand combat! 
[37]Then come with me -- Kirk, you too-- you're not supposed to be here anyway. Radio the engine room, have Chief Engineer Olsen meet us at Shuttle Bay Five. 
[38]Let's go. 
[39]Without transporters, we can't beam off the ship, can't assist Vulcan, can't do our job. I'm creating an opportunity: Mr. Kirk, Mr. Sulu and Mr. Olson will space-jump from the shuttle. You'll have chutes -- you'll land on that machine they've lowered into the atmosphere that's scrambling our gear-- you'll get inside, disable that thing then beam back to the ship. 
[40]Mr. Spock, I'm leaving you in command of the ship. Once we have transport capability and communications back up, you'll contact Starfleet and report what the hell's happening here. 
[41]Something you've got only precious few minutes to figure out. If all else fails, fall back and rendezvous with the fleet in the Laurentian System. Kirk. I'm promoting you to First Officer. 
[42]While I'm gone we need to keep the chain of command. And you two make a swell team. 
[43]It's not a prank, Spock.   And I'm not the Captain. You are. 
[44]I guess you'll have to come get me. Careful with the ship. She's brand new. 
[45]Suit up, Gentlemen. 
[46]Pre-jump on one: Three, two, one. 
[47]Good luck. 
[48]I'm Captain Christopher Pi-- 
[49]So much for diplomacy. 
[50]Christopher Pike -- Captain, U.S.S. Enterprise, registry NCC-1701. 
[51]No. You answer for the genocide you just committed on a peaceful planet-- 
[52]Then Nero, you're confused. Romulus has not been destroyed. How can you blame the Federation for something that hasn't happened--? 
[53]If what you say is true... you can save Romulus. You have a second chance to -- 
[54]Then we have nothing more to discuss. 
[55]How reassuring. 
[56]Christopher Pike -- Captain, U.S.S. Enterprise, registry NCC-1701. 
[57]... Kirk? 
[58]I am relieved. Congratulations, Captain. 
[59]... I am relieved. 
[60]And as Fleet Admiral, for your... unique solution to the Kobayashi Maru, it's my honor to award you with a commendation for original thinking. 
[61]Congratulations, Captain.
dialogues.MCCOY:
[1]Maybe-- 
[2]I have no interest. 
[3]I'm about to ask you an obvious question: why bother? 
[4]And you're determined to make it three. We've all failed it-- everyone has, and that's the point! No one goes back for seconds, let alone thirds -- it's not like you need to pass it to graduate. 
[5]I told you to stop calling me that. You're very annoying. 
[6]You'd better study for it this time. 
[7]A date? Listen, as smart as you are, which ain't much, if you don't prepare-- 
[8]Seriously, stop calling me Bones! "Bones". 
[9]Klingon vessels have entered the Neutral Zone. And they are firing upon us. 
[10]It's okay? 
[11]Three more Klingon Warbirds decloaking -- and targeting our ship -- I don't suppose this is a problem either? 
[12]Our ship is being hit -- shields at sixty percent. 
[13]Should we at least, I dunno, fire back? 
[14]Of course not. 
[15]Jim, their shields are up. 
[16]... no. 
[17]I don't know, but I like him. 
[18]... Jim, the Board'll rule in your favor. Most likely. Look, Jim -- I gotta go -- 
[19]Doing you a favor. I couldn't just leave you there, looking all pitiful-- roll up your sleeve, I'm gonna give you a vaccine against viral infection from Melvaran mud fleas. 
[20]But I am, and Medical Code states the treatment and transport of a patient's to be determined at the discretion of his attending physician, which is me. You can see he's suffering, he needs me as his doctor, so since I'm assigned to this ship, so's he, or would you like to explain to Captain Pike why the Enterprise warped into a crisis without one of its medical officers? 
[21]As you were. 
[22]You should look at this. 
[23]Oh look, the pointy-eared bastard. 
[24]Jim, I told you to stay d-- good God! 
[25]-- I don't know-- a reaction to the vaccine -- damnit -- 
[26]-- you're not allergic to Cardassian vole dander, are you? 
[27]You need an antidote, Jim, or you're gonna die. 
[28]Jim, I'm not kidding, you gotta keep your heart rate down. 
[29]I haven't seen a reaction this severe since Med school. 
[30]You're delusional, you know that. 
[31]Come here -- Jim -- don't move -- 
[32]-- you've got Numb Tongue -- 
[33]That's not good-- I can fix that-- 
[34]Yessir. 
[35]It's McCoy-- Dr. Puri was on Deck 6, he's dead. 
[36]Aye, Sir. 
[37]And how the hell did they do that by the way? When did they jump so far ahead in the arms race? 
[38]Damnit, man, I'm a doctor, not a physicist -- are you suggesting they're from the future? 
[39]How poetic. 
[40]Fantastic, I'm in. 
[41]Does anyone understand him? 
[42]You wanted to see me? 
[43]... are you thanking me? 
[44]Permission to speak freely, Sir. 
[45]Do you. Okay then: are you out of your Vulcan mind? Were you doing the logical thing? Maybe. The right one? Debatable. But one thing's for damn sure -- that kid doesn't know how to lose. Just isn't in his DNA. Back home we have a saying: "If you're gonna ride in the Kentucky Derby, don't leave your prize stallion in the stable." 
[46]My God, Man... you could at least act like it was a hard decision. 
[47]Congratulations, Jim. Now we've got no Captain and no first officer to goddamn replace him. 
[48]
[49]Even if we could, you can't go in guns blazing, not with their technology, that's suicide. 
[50]Wait a minute-- anyone understand this kid? How old are you? 
[51]We're all old enough to shave here. 
[52]-- we're gonna need gastric stimulators, let's prep him for surgery, now! 
[53]Same ship, different day.
dialogues.UHURA:
[1]Hi. I'd like a Klabnian Fire Tea, two Cardassian Sunrises and three Earth beers, no slim-shots, anything on draft. 
[2]And a shot of Jack, straight up. 
[3]Her shot's on her. Thanks but no thanks. 
[4]I'm good without it. 
[5]Uhura. 
[6]Just Uhura. 
[7]Uhura is my last name. 
[8]Xenolinguistics. Lemme guess: you don't know what that means. 
[9]And for a moment I thought you were just a dumb hick who only has sex with farm animals. 
[10]You think you're smart. 
[11]Beyond belief, but nothing I can't handle. 
[12]Hey -- Jim: enough. 
[13]Enough!    STOP! 
[14]And you never will. 
[15]I was supposed to be, but it was crazy, I picked up an emergency transmission from a Klingon prison planet -- there was an escape and a ship stolen from th-- ... you okay? 
[16]Were you running simulations with the mouth-breather hiding under the bed? 
[17]The hell are you doing with him in here? 
[18]Get outta here -- it's my ass too if administration catches you in this dorm. 
[19]You're gonna fail. 
[20]No.   Good night. 
[21]-- we are receiving a distress signal from the U.S.S. Kobayashi Maru. The ship has lost power and is stranded. Starfleet Command has ordered us to rescue them. 
[22]And how do you expect us to rescue them when we're surrounded by Klingons? 
[23]-- the Kobayashi Maru is still in distress... but... the Klingons have stopped firing. 
[24]Commander, a word? 
[25]Was I not one of your top students? 
[26]Did I not receive a Gold rating for Exolinguistic skills, giving Starfleet first place over Kyoto and MIT at the Oxford Invitational? 
[27]-- and did I not, on multiple occasions, demonstrate exceptional aural sensitivity and, I quote, "unparalleled ability to identify sonic anomalies" in subspace transmission tests?! 
[28]And while you were well aware that my unqualified desire was to serve on the U.S.S. Enterprise, I was assigned to the Farragut. 
[29]No. No. I am assigned to the Enterprise. 
[30]What are you doing here-- what happened to your hands?! 
[31]Sir, I-- I intercepted and translated the message myself. Kirk's report is accurate. 
[32]Uhura, Sir.   All three dialects. 
[33]Captain, I pick up no Romulan transmissions -- or transmissions of any kind in the area. There seems to be something jamming all communication around Vulcan. 
[34]Captain, we're being hailed! 
[35]The jamming signal's gone -- communications are re-established -- 
[36]What?   Spock, wait -- 
[37]-- where are you going? 
[38]-- you can't beam them out? 
[39]I'm so sorry. 
[40]What can I do?     Tell me what you need. 
[41]Their trajectory suggests no other destination, Captain. 
[42]... an alternate reality. 
[43]I sure hope you know what you're doing. 
[44]I want some answers. 
[45]Right now. Where the hell'd you get trans-warp technology? 
[46]Do I look simple to you?! 
[47]No... I've been monitoring all channels. 
[48]We'll be monitoring your frequency... 
[49]Communications and transporter inoperative -- 
[50]Dock control reports ready.    Yard Command signalling clear.
dialogues.NERO:
[1]The wait is over. 
[2]Standby. 
[3]Not yet -- not like this. Not how we left. This is our chance... to serve our people. We owe it to them -- to do what no other Romulan could ever do. 
[4]Welcome back.    Spock. 
[5]Prepare the Red Matter.    Tell me when we reach core depth. 
[6]Destroy it, too. 
[7]
[8]The hull -- magnify -- 
[9]Hello. 
[10]I am called Nero. 
[11]I do not speak for the Empire. We stand apart. As does your Vulcan crew member... isn't that right? Spock? 
[12]... no, we're not. Not yet. I would like you to see something. Spock. Captain Pike-- your transporter capability is disabled. You will man a shuttle and come aboard the Narada for negotiations. That is all. 
[13]Launch the red matter. Now. 
[14]Retract the drill, let's move out! 
[15]You are only the second human I have ever met, face to face. You must have so many questions for me. 
[16]I only have one for you. I need the subspace frequencies of Starfleet's border detection grids. Specifically those surrounding Earth. 
[17]Christopher. Answer my question. 
[18]I prevented genocide. Where I come from, Christopher... this ship is just a mining vessel. I chose a life of honest labor to provide for myself... and the wife who was carrying my child. I sit here now... knowing you as enemies. Not just of today. But of tomorrow. I watched as your Federation did nothing. They let us burn to death... as our planet broke in half. 
[19]It did happen. I remember it. I... felt it. When I lost her... I promised myself I would not speak another word until the day of my retribution. In twenty five years I forgot the sound of my own voice... but I didn't forget the pain. That feeling cannot be erased. 
[20]A feeling that every surviving Vulcan now shares. 
[21]-- yes, which is a gift I won't waste on mercy. My purpose, Christopher, is not simply to avoid the destruction of the home I love... ... but to create a Romulus which exists, free of the Federation. Only then will she be saved. 
[22]It's not the fault of the human race that Starfleet chose Earth as its center. You're a more noble race than my fallen cousins. I'll take no pleasure in your extinction. 
[23]The frequencies, please. 
[24]As you wish. 
[25]There is no need, Ayel.   To threaten me. I understand. 
[26]I understand.    But you are wrong. 
[27]We will return to Romulus when the Federation lies in ruins and not a moment before. When those who watched our people burn at last understand our pain, our loss. I refuse to return as a slave! We will return as conquerors! 
[28]Deploy the drill. 
[29]Good.   Let's begin. 
[30]
[31]Restore power!     Engage auxiliary systems! 
[32]
[33]Open a channel -- 
[34]Spock -- I should've killed you when I had the chance. 
[35]You can't cheat me again, Spock. I know you better than you know yourself. 
[36]Fire at will. 
[37]I want Spock dead!    Fire! 
[38]
[39]
[40]I would rather suffer the death of Romulus a thousand times than accept assistance from you. 
[41]Forgive me... Romulus...
dialogues.SULU:
[1]Moorings retracted, Captain. Dock Control reports ready -- thrusters fired, separating from space dock -- 
[2]The fleet's cleared space dock, Captain. All ships ready for warp. 
[3]Course laid in. 
[4]Uh, he has lungworms, Sir? He'll be fine but couldn't report to his post-- I'm Hikaru Sulu -- 
[5]Very much so, Sir-- I'm not sure what's... wrong here... 
[6]-- no, I'll figure it out, just-- 
[7]Ready for warp, Sir. 
[8]... yessir. 
[9]Engines at Maximum Warp, Captain. 
[10]Arrival at Vulcan in five seconds! Four... three... two-- 
[11]Shields at thirty-two percent! Their weapons are powerful, Sir, we can't take another hit like that! 
[12]I have training, Sir! 
[13]Fencing. 
[14]
[15]None of this is familiar-- the interface, the controls-- 
[16]... thanks. 
[17]Why waste a weapon?      We weren't a threat. 
[18]As Admiral he knows details of Starfleet's defenses. 
[19]I'm sorry. 
[20]Warp three. Course one-five-one mark three, the Laurentian System. 
[21]I'm a PhD in astrophysics, I think I can handle it -- how'd you get back? 
[22]There's not a chance. They're gonna be in geosynchronous orbit around Earth in ten minutes. We'll never make it. 
[23]Mr. Chekov, transfer manual control to the Captain's chair. 
[24]Give me one quarter impulse burst for five seconds and I'll do the rest with thrusters. On my mark. Three... two... one... fire. 
[25]All stop in three... two... one... 
[26]Transporter Room. We're in stable geosynchronous orbit behind the Narada. 
[27]Yessir.   Good luck. 
[28]They're on their own now. 
[29]Maneuvering thrusters and impulse engines at your command, Sir. 
[30]Aye, Captain.
dialogues.CHEKOV:
[1]Ensign Chekov, Pavel H., Sir. 
[2]Yessir, happy to. Ensign authorization code: Nine-Five- Wictor Wictor-Two-- 
[3]Aigh, thees is the 23rd Century -- what good is woice recognition that doesn't recognize your woice? Nine-Five-Victor-Victor-Two. 
[4]Aye, Keptin. 
[5]Away team's entering the atmosphere -- 
[6]Transporter control re-engaged -- 
[7]Aye, Commander-- Keptin, sorry.    Keptin. 
[8]Keptin: gravitational sensors are off the scale -- if my calculations are correct, that pod they launched is creating a singularity... that will consume the planet. 
[9]... yessir. 
[10]... minutes, Sir. I'd say minutes. 
[11]
[12]
[13]-- holdonholdonholdonholdon! 
[14]Compensating gravitational pull and-- 
[15]Locking volume, transport in 5-4-3-- 
[16]
[17]Yes, agreed-- but why didn't they destroy us? 
[18]Not to mention we couldn't do it anyway: Nero's ship would have to drop out of warp for us to overtake them -- 
[19]Keptin, we're detecting unauthorized access to a water turbine control board! 
[20]You vant us to trust you but you von't tell us the truth? 
[21]Keptin Kirk?    Excuse me, plees, could 
[22]Based on the Narada's course from Vulcan, I've projected that Nero will travel past Saturn. If we could drop out of warp behind one of Saturn's moons, say, Titan, the magnetic distortion from the planet's rings will make us invisible to Nero's sensors. We could follow him to Earth by staying in his blind spot. 
[23]Its exhaust wake. If we adjust our shield frequencies, they shouldn't detect us. 
[24]I am seventeen, Sir, how old are you? 
[25]Aye. I've projected the parabolic course you must follow. If you deviate by so much as a meter, we will be detected. 
[26]No sign they've detected us -- 
[27]They've activated the drill -- 
[28]Keptin! The enemy ship is losing power-- its shields are down! 
[29]
[30]Weapons systems and shields on standby.
dialogues.SCOTTY:
[1]Yes, that's me -- Scotty-- you're in the right place-- are there any other hard- working and equally-starving Starfleet officers around? 
[2]You eat nothing. A bean and you're done for a week, I need food. And now you're here -- so. Thank you. Where is it. 
[3]Yes! That's exactly what I'm talking about! How d'ya think I ended up here? I got into a debate with my instructor on the issue of Relativistic Physics as they pertain to subspace travel... He seemed to think that the range of transporting say, a roast turkey, was limited to a few hundred miles -- so I told my instructor I could not only beam a bird from one planet to an adjacent planet in the same system -- which is no big deal anyway -- but if I were so inclined I could actually do it with a lifeform! So I tested it on Admiral Archer's prize beagle. Which... was a mistake. 
[4]I'll tell ya when it reappears.     Dunno. Feel guilty. 
[5]I haven't been stationed here that long. If such an equation had been discovered, I'da heard. 
[6]Y'from the future, are ya? Brilliant. D'they still have sandwiches where you're from? Piece and jam? Mince 'n tatties? Cockaleekie soup? 
[7]She's a wee bit dodgy: shield emitters are totally banjaxed, along wi' a few other things. 
[8]... rapid.   That's impressive. 
[9]Imagine that! Never occurred to me to think of space as the part that's moving. 
[10]-- Enterprise? Had its maiden voyage already, has it? Well, you must've done something right to be assigned to that ship, Kiddo. She's a well endowed lady -- love to get my hands on her ample nacelles, if you'll pardon the engineering parlance. 
[11]Look, even if I believed you -- where you're from, what I've done-- which I don't -- we're still talkin' bout slingshotting aboard while she's going faster than light. Without a proper receiving pad, that's like tryin'a hit a bullet with a smaller bullet, wearing a blindfold. On a horse. 
[12]That's all well and good unless you rematerialize four meters outside the ship. 
[13]Aye, then. Live or die, Laddie, let's get this over with. he Enterprise has a decent cafeteria I'm guessing. 
[14]-- nice --  -- ship. Really. 
[15]I'd rather not take sides. 
[16]I like this ship. It's exciting. 
[17]Well you can forget transwarp. No way to predict the Narada's position from here. 
[18]Well done, Mr. Sulu. 
[19]If there's any common sense to their ship design, I'll be puttin' ya in a cargo bay, shouldn't be a soul in sight. 
[20]Never beamed two targets from two places onto the same pad before! That was pretty good! 
[21]-- you bet yer ass, Captain -- 
[22]
[23]
[24]Dilithium chamber at maximum efficiency, Captain.
dialogues.GEORGE KIRK:
[1]Lieutenant Pitts. Transfer Robau's vital signs to the main view screen. 
[2]-- thank you. 
[3]I want to see him -- floodlights please. 
[4]He's brave.    That's what he is. 
[5]I'm initiating General Order 13! Set self-destruct for maximum matter- antimatter yield! Two minute countdown! 
[6]I want auto-pilot targeted for their fuel cells! 
[7]Then just target the damn thing dead center! 
[8]-- then I'll do it myself -- get to the shuttles, now! 
[9]All decks, this is the Captain speaking -- evacuate the ship immediately, get to your designated shuttle crafts -- 
[10]I have medical shuttle 37 standing by, get to it now -- can you do that? 
[11]I'm on my way. 
[12]I'll see you in a minute, sweetheart. 
[13]Captain to shuttle 37 -- is my wife on board? 
[14]I need you to go now, d'you hear me? 
[15]No-- go, take off, immediately. 
[16]My love?   Listen carefully, okay? 
[17]Sweetheart... I'm not going to be able to be there. 
[18]Hey!   Hey, so what is it? 
[19]It's a boy?   Yeah? 
[20]Tell me... tell me about him-- please-- 
[21]I know-- so what should we call him, huh? 
[22]Tiberius? Are you kidding me? No, that's the worst-- we'll name him after your dad-- let's call him Jim.
dialogues.CAPTAIN ROBAU:
[1]Report. 
[2]Any response? 
[3]Maybe they're incapable -- any identifiable damage? 
[4]Confused? 
[5]... oh my God... A lightning storm... then this... Signal all departments: first contact protocols. Looks like we have someone new on the block. All Stop. 
[6]That could be seen as an act of provocation -- all readings passive-- 
[7]Damage report! 
[8]All remaining power to forward shields! Prepare the shuttles f-- 
[9]Walk with me. 
[10]If I don't report within fifteen minutes, execute general order 13. 
[11]There is no help for us out here. If we're going down, we're taking them with us -- you save as many as you can. 
[12]You're Captain now. Mr. Kirk. 
[13]Computer, initiate departure sequence. 
[14]Who is your commander? Is it him? 
[15]Then ask your commander what right he has to attack a Federation vessel. 
[16]I've never seen it. Or any ship like it. 
[17]I am unfamiliar with Ambassador Spock. 
[18]... Stardate? ... it's 2233.04. ... hey, where are you from--? 
[19]... oh my God... A lightning storm... then this... Signal all departments: first contact protocols. Looks like we have someone new on the block. All Stop. 
[20]That could be seen as an act of provocation -- all readings passive-- 
[21]Damage report!
dialogues.SAREK:
[1]Well done. 
[2]Your tone suggests disappointment. The Science Council required my presence for a session regarding-- 
[3]As you are aware, the Vulcan male is traditionally not present at the moment of delivery. 
[4]You are correct. I should have been here. I am sorry. 
[5]I had a thought. That we might name the child after one of our respected early society-builders. His name was "Spock". 
[6]Your silence does not suggest enormous enthusiasm. 
[7]The child has your eyes. 
[8]In marriage... conflict is... 
[9]Natural. Emotions run deep within our race. In many ways, more deeply than in humans. Long ago, they nearly destroyed us... that is why we followed the teachings of Surak. Now you must choose. 
[10]Never, my son. But you may choose the ethic of logic. Logic offers a serenity humans seldom experience. The control of feelings... so that they do not control you. 
[11]As Ambassador to Earth, my duty is to observe and understand human behavior. Marrying your mother... was logical. Spock. You are fully capable of choosing your own destiny. The question you are faced with... is which path you will take. This is something only you can decide. 
[12]
[13]Spock! 
[14]You must not punish yourself. Speak your mind, Spock. 
[15]What is necessary is always wise. 
[16]You will always be a child of two worlds. I am grateful for that. And for you. And not only because you are all I have left of her. 
[17]I believe she would say... do not try to. You asked me once. Why I married your mother. I married her because I loved her.
dialogues.WINONA:
[1]-- what was that-- what's happening?! 
[2]Medical bay-- I had a few close contractions-- I'm fine-- what was that? 
[3]-- George! 
[4]Yes -- where are you? 
[5]Good-- and George, it's coming-- our baby, it's coming now. 
[6]-- Agh!   That was-- that was a big one! 
[7]-- the baby, too, right? 
[8]Wait! We can't go, my husband isn't here yet! Please! STOP--! 
[9]The shuttle's leaving-- where are you? 
[10]-- we're about to have this baby -- 
[11]-- no-- no, no-- wait-- 
[12]He's-- he's beautiful, he looks like you. 
[13]George, you should be here -- 
[14]We could name him after your father. 
[15]... Jim.   Jim it is.
dialogues.AMANDA:
[1]... hello. 
[2]Thanks. 
[3]Don't do that.     You knew I wanted you here. 
[4]Well traditionally, I'm not the one giving birth. 
[5]I moved here -- to another planet -- to be with you. I needed you to be with me today. Holding my hand and telling me I'm doing great, even when I'm just... breathing the best I can. 
[6]No... Spock. ... Spock. 
[7]... and your ears. 
[8]Spock, come here, let me see you. 
[9]Spock. 
[10]There is no need to be so anxious. You'll do fine. 
[11]... anything. 
[12]As always... whoever you choose to be... you will have a proud mother. 
[13]Spock--! 
[14]It's okay.   To be scared.
dialogues.AYEL:
[1]My commander requests the presence of your captain in order to negotiate a cease-fire. You will come aboard our ship via shuttlecraft. Your refusal would be unwise. 
[2]Are you familiar with this craft? 
[3]You will speak only to me. 
[4]That was hardly an attack. My commander will easily destroy your ship. If you do not respond to the question. 
[5]Are you familiar with -- or better, know the location of -- Ambassador Spock? 
[6]A final question. What is the current stardate? 
[7]Commander Nero -- we're surrounded. 
[8]Sir-- what are your orders? 
[9]We have arrived at the coordinates you requested. Stardate confirmed. 2258.5. 
[10]Captain... long range scans of Beta Quadrant complete. Romulus is there. She's there. We could go. Right now, go home... 
[11]The men and I have discussed this. What we are about to do. We have to turn the ship around. We can save our home. 
[12]Stop. 
[13]We can go back. That's what we want. We have taken our vengeance on Vulcan. No more. We want to go home now.
dialogues.CADET:
[1]Heard that guy passed second-year exams in his first term. 
[2]Ruining the curve for everyone. 
[3]I'd like to load her photon tubes. 
[4]Can't believe I failed the navigational comp. 
[5]The Newton's not an antique, it's a classic. Give me the Newton over the Enterprise any day. 
[6]Did you see the new assignment roster? 
[7]I flunked the sub-atomic particles quiz. 
[8]They better give me a red shirt for this. 
[9]Do we have time to get married? 
[10]I know this is sudden, but... will you marry me? 
[11]I'm calling my Mom... 
[12]Can't believe I'm on the Mayflower...
dialogues.ROMULAN OFFICER:
[1]Secure the transport deck. 
[2]Security team to the docking bay. Report. 
[3]Bring the prisoner to the bridge. 
[4]Secure the prisoner and take him to the brig. 
[5]Federation defenses are weak in this era. 
[6]Prepare shuttles for evacuation. 
[7]Communications -- monitor all Federation channels. 
[8]Scramble signals on all Federation channels. 
[9]Long live the Romulan Star Empire. 
[10]We are being attacked. 
[11]Stinking Klingons.
dialogues.ENSIGN:
[1]All com channels open. 
[2]We have clearance from Starfleet. 
[3]Proceeding as directed. 
[4]Transporter deck is operational. 
[5]Shields at one-hundred percent and stable. 
[6]Engineering reports warp core is stable. 
[7]Warp propulsion system is at maximum efficiency. 
[8]Warp drive is off line, we are on impulse only, repeat, impulse only. 
[9]Sir, we've been detected -- Romulan vessel is turning about. 
[10]Hull breach on deck 38, atmospheric stabilization has been lost. 
[11]Life support is fluctuating.
dialogues.ACADEMY PRESIDENT:
[1]James T. Kirk.     Step forward. 
[2]An incident has occurred today that concerns the entire student body. Academic immorality by one is an assault on us all. It will. Not. Stand. Cadet Kirk, evidence has been submitted to this council suggesting you violated the ethical code of conduct pursuant to regulation 17.43 of the Starfleet code. Is there anything you care to say before we begin? 
[3]Step forward please. This is Commander Spock, one of our most distinguished graduates. He's programmed the Kobayashi Maru test for the last four years. 
[4]In academic vernacular, you cheated. 
[5]Mr. Kirk, I don't see how the intent of the exam is relevant to these proceedings. 
[6]We've received a distress call from Vulcan. Cadet Kirk -- you are on academic probation pending the result of your hearing. Cadets, report to Shuttle Hangar One immediately -- this hearing is at recess until further notice -- dismissed. 
[7]This assembly calls Captain James Tiberius Kirk... 
[8]Your inspirational valor and supreme dedication to your comrades are in keeping with the highest traditions of service and reflect utmost credit to yourself, your crew, and the Federation. For your... unique solution to the Kobayashi Maru, it's my honor to award you with a commendation for original thinking. 
[9]By Starfleet Order 28455, you are hereby directed to report to Commanding Officer, USS Enterprise, for duty as his relief.
dialogues.OFFICER PITTS:
[1]No Sir -- hails met with silence. 
[2]Negative, Sir -- but our readings seem confused-- 
[3]-- not only is the ship unregistered -- but even its construction materials seem unrecognizable. 
[4]They're firing another, Captain! 
[5]Yessir. 
[6]The shuttle's pulling out of main bay, Sir. 
[7]His heart rate's elevated-- 
[8]Yessir!
dialogues.COMPUTER VOICE:
[1]Your score is one-hundred percent. Congratulations. Spock. 
[2]Lieutenant Uhura is at signals monitoring station twelve -- deck four. 
[3]Current location Delta Vega: Class "M" Planet, unsafe. You have been ordered to remain in your pod until retrieved by Starfleet authorities. 
[4]Turbine Shutdown Not Allowed. 
[5]Voice print and face recognition analysis enabled. 
[6]Welcome back, Ambassador Spock. 
[7]Stardate 2397, commissioned by the Vulcan Science Academy. 
[8]Warning: Shields off-line.
dialogues.VULCAN CIVILIAN:
[1]Where is planetary security? 
[2]The planet is coming apart! 
[3]Hope is beyond reason. 
[4]Stay together and keep moving. 
[5]Planetary evacuation is in progress. 
[6]This is highly improbable. 
[7]It seems we are under attack. 
[8]I await my fate with a clear consciences.
dialogues.FIRST OFFICER:
[1]Sir, new contact bearing zero-three-four. 
[2]Sir, should we initiate an invasive scan? 
[3]-- you're okay-- thank God-- where are you? 
[4]Just sit tight-- stay there-- we'll be fine-- 
[5]Sir, we could issue a mayday call to-- 
[6]... aye, Captain. 
[7]Sir, should we initiate an active scan?
dialogues.NURSE:
[1]We're packing it up -- you'll deliver in the shuttle! 
[2]Just keep breathing, Honey, you're gonna be just fine-- 
[3]-- the baby too. 
[4]You'll need to push now-- are you ready? 
[5]Class four casualties here, class three in the next door. 
[6]This should numb the pain. 
[7]Airways clear.
dialogues.YOUNG SPOCK:
[1]I presume you've prepared new insults for today. 
[2]I have no such information. 
[3]This is your thirty-fifth attempt to elicit an emotional response from me. Logic dictates you would cease by now. 
[4]I did not mean to create conflict between you and mother. 
[5]... constant? 
[6]... between you and mother? 
[7]They called you a traitor. You suggest that I should be completely Vulcan... and yet you married a human... why?
dialogues.KLINGON INTERROGATOR:
[1]I have come far to meet you. "The One Who Does Not Speak." Ten years is a long time to maintain silence. Perhaps you simply do not speak Klingon, just as I do not speak Romulan. 
[2]But I assume we both speak the language of our common enemy. 
[3]We found this book in your cell. Cartography, mathematics-- what do these mean? This date here -- eleven years from now-- what happens then? 
[4]When you were captured we assumed you were a spy, sent from Romulus to surveil the Empire. But because the Romulans deny your existence, I believe you are much more than that. 
[5]Your ship remains in orbit above us now. We've been asking for its secrets for too long. That is why I am here. We want to know how it works and I believe now, finally... you will tell us. 
[6]Centaurian slugs. Their native planet is in constant sunlight. As a result, there's nothing they hate more... than darkness. 
[7]They try to claw and bite their way out of any dark space they're in.
dialogues.ROMULAN ENSIGN:
[1]Anterior hull breach, deck level seven. 
[2]Security breach in the docking bay, tracking now... 
[3]The Vulcans value logic but not honor. 
[4]No remaining signal - the vessel is gone. 
[5]Captain we have a new contact. 
[6]Firing solution ready. 
[7]Sir, tracking new contact.
